intro: Dorstenia martiana, commonly known as the "Cushion Plant," is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth habit. The plant features palmate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming in the spring. Dorstenia martiana is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
